Text: thanks again beechyboy! i was wondering what happened there before : totally appreciated.
Good effort, however this is an extremely poor encode. It's riddled with errors. Either wait for another source or re-encode with ffmpeg.
Nice try, but this is unwatchable.  Sound & picture is distorted in places when played on PC with VLC player.  When played on PS3 I get a corrupt data error after a few seconds.
i felt like i was on acid watching that. still watchable though.
No sound after about the first 25 secs. Picture is poor in some parts. Anyone else have the same problem with no sound for pretty much the entire show.

It seems to be reading the partial old file as the full new file so that the this file is actually only 92% complete when it reads fully complete. I think this will need another upload under a different name.
it's shit, hacks and looses sound, pixels up every 2-3 minutes.

DAM!!!  I started using Handbrake to encode video. 
                          NEVER AGAIN!!!

Sorry
Always use ffmpeg. If you want a GUI, use WinFF. In my experience, it's the only encoder that works 100% of the time.

I'll check out WinFF.

Thanks for the advice Kilroy.
Hey Kelroy have you ever tried XMedia Recode ?
